context.description: Use this view to catalog and organize reusable programming objects, such as HTML tagging, JavaScript, and JSP markup, along with custom tags, that can be embedded in existing files.
Supply values in this dialog to define the Snippets view object to be inserted in the current file at the cursor position. Assign a value to the variables being inserted.

topic.label: Inserting and editing items in the active editor

context.description:
In the Name field, type the name of the object as you want it be displayed in the Snippets view. Optionally, add a description of the object in the Description field.
Select the Hide check box to make this snippet object not visible in the view.
To add a new variable, click the New push button, and type values in the cells of the Variables table. The Name field represents name of the variable that will be inserted when you add it to a document. Default value is the initial value of the named variable. Optionally, add a description of the variable.
Insert the variables that you define into the Template Pattern field using the Insert Variable Placeholder push button.

topic.label: Deleting or hiding snippet items or drawers

context.description:
Type the name of the new category in the Name field and optionally add a description of the category in the Description field.
Select Open drawer at start-up to have the category drawer opened in the Snippets view when the workbench starts up.
You can specify how you want the category drawer displayed in the Snippets view by selecting a radio button for the Show/Hide Drawer field.
